references.paper_title: ediff-i: Text-to-image diffusion models with an ensemble of expert denoisers
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel approach to text-to-image diffusion models that utilizes an ensemble of expert denoisers, which is relevant to the current paper's use of diffusion models for image relighting.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the superiority of diffusion models over Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for image synthesis, which is highly relevant to the current paper's use of diffusion models for image relighting.
This paper introduces classifier-free diffusion guidance, a technique used in the current paper for improving the quality and detail preservation of the generated relit images.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces a high-resolution image synthesis method using latent diffusion models, which is the foundation model used in the current paper for portrait relighting.

references.paper_title: SwitchLight: Co-design of physics-driven architecture and pre-training framework for human portrait relighting
references.reason: This paper is a state-of-the-art method for portrait relighting that uses a physics-driven architecture and pre-training framework, which serves as a strong baseline for comparison in the current paper.
